body_content.explanation: a group of islands to the west of Scotland that together with the Inner Hebrides form the Hebrides group. The Outer Hebrides are a longer distance from the mainland (= main part) of Scotland:
examples: The populated Outer Hebrides, or Western Isles, comprise the Isles of Lewis and Harris, North and South Uist, Benbecula, Scalpay and Barra.
The Outer Hebrides remain the heartland of Gaelic culture, with the language spoken by the vast majority of islanders.
